intro: Tibouchina incarum, commonly known as the purple glorybower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Tibouchina incarum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
